inputs.name: SNMP Poll Interval
inputs.help_text: Set the interval for polling the Network Infrastructure Devices.

inputs.name: DHCP Sniffing Mode
inputs.help_text: Select the DHCP Sniffing mode for external or internal ports.

inputs.name: TCP Sniffing Mode
inputs.help_text: Enable profiling of devices using TCP.

inputs.name: SMB Sniffing Mode
inputs.help_text: Enable profiling of devices using SMB.

inputs.name: Purge Interval
inputs.help_text: Set the interval to purge older devices from the database.

inputs.name: Profile Discovered Devices with NMAP
inputs.help_text: Enable profiling of all discovered devices using NMAP.

actions.description: Save the changes made in the General Settings.
Reset all fields in the General Settings to their default values.

constraints.constraint: Value must be between 1 and 1440 minutes.
Must select one of the predefined options: Never, Daily, Weekly, Monthly.

errors.description: SNMP Poll Interval must be a valid integer between 1 and 1440.
Purge Interval must be one of the allowed values: Never, Daily, Weekly, Monthly.

steps: Navigate to Settings > Profiler > General Settings.
Select the desired DHCP Sniffing Mode.
Optionally enable TCP or SMB Sniffing Modes.
Set the Purge Interval for older devices.
Optionally enable profiling of discovered devices using NMAP.
Click Save to apply the changes.

image_insights.insights: The Basic Configuration screen includes tabs, buttons, text fields, and dropdown menus for configuring profiler settings. Fields include SNMP Poll Interval, DHCP Sniffing Mode, and options for TCP/SMB Sniffing.
